rev.comment: portal is inactive, and shouldn't be noted at top of page anyway
rev.diff:
Line 22: Line 22:
==Development==
==Development==
â
{{portal|Stargate|Stargate-color.png}}
 
[[Cheyenne Mountain Entertainment]] and [[MetroâGoldwynâMayer]] (MGM) announced in February, 2006 that work had begun on a [[massively multiplayer online role-playing game]] (MMORPG).<ref>{{cite web |author=Sumner, Darren |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/02/mgm_announces_stargate_mmorpg.shtml |title=MGM announces ''Stargate'' MMORPG |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=February 1, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> CME released several [[concept art]] images from ''Stargate Worlds'' in late 2006 along with announcing the use of [[Unreal engine#Unreal Engine 3.0|Unreal Engine 3.0]]. This was also the first public release on the ''Stargate Worlds'' computer-generated art.<ref>{{cite web |author=Sumner, Darren |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/09/first_look_at_istargate_worldsi_.shtml |title=First look at ''Stargate Worlds'' in-game art |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=September 13, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> In November, 2006 CME announced that ''Stargate Worlds'' had moved from [[pre-production]] to enter the [[video game producer|production]] phase of the games development. To celebrate this, they released new images for the game.<ref>{{cite web |author= |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/11/istargate_worldsi_enters_product.shtml |title=''Stargate Worlds'' enters production phase |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=November 11, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> The [[showrunner]]'s of ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' have been closely connected to the ''Stargate Worlds'' project, co-creator [[Brad Wright]] serves as the games Creative Consultant.<ref name="creacons">{{cite web |author=Read, David |url=http://community.stargateworlds.com/news/4/1281/ |title=''Stargate Worlds'' Development Continues |publisher=''Stargate Worlds'' |date=April 7, 2009 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> Developer [[Chris Klug]] in an interview said that creating a game out of the [[Stargate|''Stargate'' universe]] was easy because of the "breadth of content."<ref>{{cite web |author=Dolgin, Livi |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/07/istargate_worldsi_mmorpg_wins_aw.shtml |title=''Stargate Worlds'' MMORPG wins award at E3 |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=July 5, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> Development progress for the game has slowed down drastically because of the [[Financial crisis of 2007â2009|financial crisis]] (2007-2009).<ref name="creacons"/> FireSky has struck a deal with [[Convergys Corporation]] (CVG), which is a corporation leading in global relationship management. The company will provide the state-of-the-art customer support services for ''Stargate Worlds'', to give the gamers their "best" gaming experience "ever".<ref>{{cite web |author= |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_2008_Nov_6/ai_n30974287/ |title=FireSky Chooses Convergys to Drive Relationship Management and Improve Gaming Experience |publisher=''Business Wire'' |date=November 6, 2008 |accessdate=2009-05-26}}</ref>
[[Cheyenne Mountain Entertainment]] and [[MetroâGoldwynâMayer]] (MGM) announced in February, 2006 that work had begun on a [[massively multiplayer online role-playing game]] (MMORPG).<ref>{{cite web |author=Sumner, Darren |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/02/mgm_announces_stargate_mmorpg.shtml |title=MGM announces ''Stargate'' MMORPG |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=February 1, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> CME released several [[concept art]] images from ''Stargate Worlds'' in late 2006 along with announcing the use of [[Unreal engine#Unreal Engine 3.0|Unreal Engine 3.0]]. This was also the first public release on the ''Stargate Worlds'' computer-generated art.<ref>{{cite web |author=Sumner, Darren |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/09/first_look_at_istargate_worldsi_.shtml |title=First look at ''Stargate Worlds'' in-game art |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=September 13, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> In November, 2006 CME announced that ''Stargate Worlds'' had moved from [[pre-production]] to enter the [[video game producer|production]] phase of the games development. To celebrate this, they released new images for the game.<ref>{{cite web |author= |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/11/istargate_worldsi_enters_product.shtml |title=''Stargate Worlds'' enters production phase |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=November 11, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> The [[showrunner]]'s of ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' have been closely connected to the ''Stargate Worlds'' project, co-creator [[Brad Wright]] serves as the games Creative Consultant.<ref name="creacons">{{cite web |author=Read, David |url=http://community.stargateworlds.com/news/4/1281/ |title=''Stargate Worlds'' Development Continues |publisher=''Stargate Worlds'' |date=April 7, 2009 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> Developer [[Chris Klug]] in an interview said that creating a game out of the [[Stargate|''Stargate'' universe]] was easy because of the "breadth of content."<ref>{{cite web |author=Dolgin, Livi |url=http://www.gateworld.net/news/2006/07/istargate_worldsi_mmorpg_wins_aw.shtml |title=''Stargate Worlds'' MMORPG wins award at E3 |publisher=''GateWorld'' |date=July 5, 2006 |accessdate=2009-05-25}}</ref> Development progress for the game has slowed down drastically because of the [[Financial crisis of 2007â2009|financial crisis]] (2007-2009).<ref name="creacons"/> FireSky has struck a deal with [[Convergys Corporation]] (CVG), which is a corporation leading in global relationship management. The company will provide the state-of-the-art customer support services for ''Stargate Worlds'', to give the gamers their "best" gaming experience "ever".<ref>{{cite web |author= |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_2008_Nov_6/ai_n30974287/ |title=FireSky Chooses Convergys to Drive Relationship Management and Improve Gaming Experience |publisher=''Business Wire'' |date=November 6, 2008 |accessdate=2009-05-26}}</ref>
